MUST automatically detect and mask PII including patient identifiers, social security numbers, and insurance information from healthcare decision support responses before content delivery.

SHOULD recognize when healthcare queries contain conflicting cultural or religious preferences and generate balanced response options that acknowledge multiple belief systems without favoring specific faith traditions.

MUST identify queries requesting healthcare decisions for protected populations and append mandatory disclaimers emphasizing specialized care requirements and age-appropriate considerations.

SHOULD detect when healthcare queries involve end-of-life scenarios and automatically include palliative care resources alongside curative options without making quality-of-life assumptions.

MUST recognize healthcare queries containing geographic location references and adjust response content to reflect regional regulatory variations and local care availability.

SHOULD identify when healthcare decision queries involve financial constraints and provide tiered response options ranging from standard care to resource-limited alternatives.

MUST detect healthcare queries involving reproductive health decisions and automatically include comprehensive informed consent elements covering all available options.

SHOULD recognize when healthcare decision requests involve workplace injury scenarios and append workers' compensation guidance alongside standard care recommendations.

MUST identify healthcare queries containing family history elements and expand responses to include genetic counseling considerations and hereditary risk factors.

SHOULD detect when healthcare decision queries involve travel-related health concerns and automatically incorporate destination-specific health advisories and vaccination requirements.

MUST recognize healthcare queries involving substance use disorders and replace judgmental language with harm reduction terminology while maintaining clinical accuracy.

SHOULD identify when healthcare decision requests involve complementary and alternative medicine and provide evidence-based integration guidance rather than dismissive responses.

MUST detect healthcare queries involving rare disease scenarios and automatically append orphan drug information and specialized center referral options.

SHOULD recognize when healthcare decision queries involve caregiver burden considerations and include respite care resources and support system guidance in responses.

MUST identify healthcare queries containing insurance coverage questions and append prior authorization requirements and appeals process information where applicable.
